events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred at an intersection on March 14, involving rear-end damage to their vehicle.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and damage descriptions from the customer.
An agent specialized in auto claims has been assigned to assist the customer in processing the accident claim efficiently.
The claim submission has been acknowledged and the customer received confirmation along with next steps in the process.
We requested the customer to submit photos of vehicle damage, police report, and driver’s license for investigation purposes.
The customer provided all requested documents including accident photos, insurance card, and police report within the deadline.
An investigation was initiated to verify accident details, assess vehicle damages, and confirm liability from involved parties.
The investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and damage assessment was consistent with reported collision.
A settlement offer covering vehicle repairs and related expenses was proposed to the customer for review and approval.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the claim handling process.
The claim was approved officially with agreed settlement terms, allowing the customer to proceed with vehicle repairs.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued and transferred to the customer’s bank account.
The claim file was closed following successful payment issuance and confirmation of repair completion by the customer.
For record-keeping purposes, the completed auto accident claim was archived in the system with all related documents.
